title: A New Point of View!
detail_text: <:th_ch0201/>What makes a monster fascinating...... Hmm... I can’t think of anything. They’ll always be the protagonist’s sworn rival, right? And they’ll always have opposing ideologies?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0207/>Yes, those are both given. It’s a recurring theme, and as their disagreement grows larger, the antagonist evolves further into a monster.<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0203/>Another recurring theme is that the protagonist and the antagonists used to be best friends. But as they grow up, their values and morals grow more and more divided......<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0201/>A-Are there cases where they were childhood friends!?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0207/>I’ve seen that quite often.<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0203/>Those stories are always heartrending. The last time I watched a movie with a story like that, I got quite choked up.<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0201/>Yeah... I can see how that would be painful to watch...... But I get it now. Monsters can be quite fascinating too!! Could I write the script for our play then, please?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0207/>You want to do it, Ayumu-san!? ......That would be awesome! Shizuku and I might only have cliché ideas in mind, so I think you’ll come up with something Shizuku and I could never come up with!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0203/>Yeah! You might have a new point of view that we don’t have! Please come up with a scenario that makes the most of your fresh perspective, Ayumu-san!!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0201/>Alright, leave it to me! I’ll do my best!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0000/>Translated by SIFAStheatre and Idol Story<:dt_line_end/>
